Sur celte somme, 500,000 francs suisses furent verses le ler novembre 1920, et le solde sera regie au moyen de dix versements egaux a effectuer tous les six mois. En outre, a partir du ler novembre 1920 on devra payer un interet sur le solde du prix d'achat a mesure que les versements partiels viendront a echeance. Le taux de l'interet est etabli d'apres le taux officiel de la Banque Nationale Suissepour chaque semestre ecoule.Lors de 1'achat de 1'immeuble, on le reparait de fond en comble, car 1'intention de la Compagnie de 1'hdtel etait de remeltre le batiment entierement a neuf. Les plans de Tarchitecte ont ete mis a execution dans la mesure ou ils s'adaptaient aux besoins de la Societe. LEAGUE OF NATIONSDetailed Explanation of the Third Budget of the League of nations-CAPITAL expenditure .-PAYMENT ON ACCOUNT OF BALANCE OF PURCHASE PRICEOF HOTEL NATIONAL, GENEVASwiss Francs.a) Second Instalment, due 1st May500,000Interest estimated at 70/o on 5,000,000 Swiss fcs. for six months . 175,000As a result of the resolution adopted by the Council of the. League of Nations at its San Sebastian Session, the Secretary-General was authorised to proceed to Geneva to secure suitable accommodation for the League.At the outset it seemed essentialthat the property chosen should fulfil the following requirements:1, It should be in a good position with plenty of light and air, not hidden from view, but prominently situated.2. It should not be too far from the business centre of Geneva, as it necessarily has to be of easy access for visitors and members ot the Secretariat.3. Its immediate surroundings should not be occupied by large buildings so that as the work of the League expands adjoining properties might be secured at reasonable cost.4. It should be sufficiently spacious to contain not only the Secretariat and the Auxiliary Commissions, but it should also be large enough to furnish the necessary accommodation for meetings of the League Council and for special Conferences.After visiting several properties in Geneva the Secretary-General and his colleagues came to the conclusion that the Hotel National was the only property that would serve the purpose and fulfil the above requirements.The owners offered to sell the property for 6,500,000 Swiss francs, but, after some negotiations they agreed to accept the sum of 5,500,000 Swiss francs. Of this sum 500,000 Swiss francs were paid on the 1st November, 1920, and the balance will be settled in 10 equal instalments every six months. In addition, interest cn the balance of the purchase price shall be paid, from November 1st, 1920 as each instalment becomes due. The rate of interest is based on the Swiss National Bank official rate current during each preceding six months'period.When the property was purchased it was undergoing thorough repairs, as it had been the intention of the Hotel Company entirely to renovate the building. The architectural-tecfs plans have been carried out in so far as they were of such a nature as to render the building suitable for occupation by the League.b) Third Instalment, due 1st November................Interest at 7% on 4,500,000 Swiss fcs. for six months500.000 157,500L. of N. - D 39 - Imp. Son prix d'achat serait de 700,000 francs suisses,et la Societe des Nations serait creditee des paiements bi annuelsde 5,000 francs suisses, qu'elles'estengageea effectuer pendant la duree de Toption (trois ans a dater du 1" novembre 1920) Ces paiements viendraient en deduction de sa dette.II. - La propriete occupant une superflcie de 44 ares est sise entre le quai du Leman et la rue des Paquis, et altenante a 1'Hotel National.Son prix d'achat serait de 675,000 francs suisses et la Societe des Nations serait creditee des paiemenls bi-annuels de 8,333 francs qu'elle s'est engagee a effectuer pendant la duree de 1'option (trois ans a dater du ler novembre 1920). Ges paiements viendraient en reduction de sa dette.L'une des conditions de la vente de THotel National fut que la Societe des Nations racheterait a la societe exploitant Thotel le mobilier qui pourrait convenir a ses travaux. Gette condition fut considered comme avantageuse, car il eut ete tres difficile de se procurer a bref delai le mobilier necessaire; en outre, le prix d'achat en etait raison-nsble. (ionformement aux termes du contrat, deux experts, Tun designe par la societe exploitant 1'hotel, et Fautre par la Societe des Nations, out examine et evalue tout le mobilier, et 1'officier d'administi'ation a choisi les articles que la Societe pourrait acheter.Apres mure reflexion, on decida d'amenager la Bibliotheque a 1'aide de rayons et de casiers d'acier, et cela pour des raisons d'uniformite, de duree et de securite. Un contrat a ete passe avec une maison specialisee dans 1'installation des bibliotheques pour une somme de 35,000 francs suisses.3. - MOBILIERValeur prevue: 500,000 francs suisses.4. - INSTALLATION DE LA BIBLIOTHEQUEa) RAYONS, etc.35,000 francs suisses.b) LIVRES, PERIODIQUES, etc.200,000 francs suisses.Le bibliothecaire estime qae pour entretenir le fonds de la bibliotheque par des achats de livres, de cartes et de periodiques, il faut disposer d'environ 160,000 francs suisses par an, et qu'il faut en outre, une somme de 15,000 francs suisses pour les The Council at its Paris Session in September approved the draft Contracts for the purchase of this property, and designated Sir Eric Dnmimond and Sir Herbert Ames to execute them on its behalf.4.-PAYMENTS TO MAINTAIN THE OPTIONS ON ADJOINING PROPERTIES:Swiss francs.(a) "Villa" Properly payable 1st May ........................... 5,000payable 1st November....................... 5,000(b) * Armleder* Properly - payable 1st May....................... 8,388payable 1st November.................. 8,834The Hotel National property covers 8,600 square metres. Since it would be impos-sible to erect further structures on the property without interfering with the view and cutting down a large number of trees, thereby depreciating the value of the estate, the Council, on the same occasion, agreed that options should be secured on two neigh-bouring properties.Three-year options were therefore secured on the following properties:T. - A triangular property covering 38 ares, situated immediately behind the Hotel National, between the Rue des Paquis, the Rue Rothschild and the Rue des Buis. Its purchase price would be 700,000 Swiss francs, against which the League of Nations would be credited with the half-yearly payments of 5,000 Swiss francs which it has undertaken to make for the duration of the option (3 years from November 1st, 1920).II. - The property, covering 44 ares, situated between the Quai du Leman and the Rue des Paquis, and adjoining the Hotel National.Its purchase price would be 675,000 francs, against which the League of Nations would be credited with the half-yearly payments of 8,333 francs which it has undertaken to make for the duration of the option (three years from November 1st, 1920).8.-FURNITURE Estimated value: 500,000 Swiss francs.One of the conditions of sale of the Hotel National was that the League should purchase from the Hotel Company such furniture as might be suitable for the carrying on of its work. This was found to be an advantage, as it would otherwise have been very difficult to procure the necessary furniture at short notice; moreover, it was offered and bought at a reasonable price. According to the terms of the contract, two experts, one nominated by the Hotel Company and the other by the League of Nations, examined and valued all the furniture, and the Establishment Officer decided what could he usefully bought by the League.4.-LIBRARY INSTALLATION(a) SHELVING, etc.35,000 Swiss francs.After much consideration, it was decided to equip the Library throughout with steel shelves and racks. This was deemed advisable for reasons of uniformity, durability and safety. A contract, amounting to 35,000 Swiss francs, has been placed with a firm specialising in Library equipment.(b) BOOKS, PERIODICALS, etc. 200,000 Swiss francs.The Librarian estimates that in order to buy the necessary current books, maps and periodicals, the sum of approximately 160,000 Swiss francs should be set aside for the year, and a further sum of 15,000 Swiss francs is required for binding. The balance ot frais de reliure. Si Ton constate que cette installation permet de realiser line economic, on proposera de la faire approuver.Si la Societe possede sa propre installation, elle pourra ou bien executer elie-meme ses travaux, ou passer un contrat avec une raaison competente qui exploiterait 1'imprimerie en regie et qui serait remboursee du montant des frais, plus une commission.6-AUTRES FRAIS D'INSTALLATION 48,477 francs suisses.Le contrat passe avec la Societe Sexploitation de THotel National prevoit que rimmeuble sera acbeve suivant le plan des architectes de la societe exploitant Thfitel. Cependant, il faudra probablement apporter certaines modifications au plan primitif, afin (1'adapler 1'immeuble aux besoins du Secretariat.II faudra egalemenl modifier les installations d*eclairage a 1'interienr de l"hdtel, afin de transformer les locaux en bureaux. Hie estimate has been reserved in ease there should he an opportunity of buying tit ti low price a collection of books, the possession of which might be indispensable to the League.5.-PRINTING OFFICE 250,000 Swiss francs (if installed'by the League),A certain number of firms in Switzerland, Prance and England estimated on the installation in the basement of the offices of the Secretarial, of a Printing office huge enough to deal with the current printing work of the League. Should it be found that the installation of such a plant would result in economy it is proposed to sanction its establishment.Were the League in possession of a printing office, it could either carry on its own work or could contract wild a competent firm to operate the plant on a cost plus commission basis.6. - ADDITIONAL INSTALLATIONS48,477 Swiss francs.The contract entered into with the Hotel National Company provided thai the building should be completed according to the plan of the architects in the employ of the Hotel Company. A certain number of changes from the original plan will, however, probably have to be made in order to adapt the building to the needs of the Secretariat.The internal lighting arrangements of the Hotel will also have lo be altered, in order to render the building suitable for office use. II. - DEPENSES DIRECTES1. - TRALTEMENTS, SA LA IRES, ALLOCATIONSa) SECRETARIAT4/200,000 francs-or.On eslime que, a Pepoque du I01' Janvier 1921, les trailements mensuels reguliers 8'eleveront a une somrne d'environ 300,000 francs-or. Un certain nombre de sections, telles que celles du Transit et des Mandals, n'ont pas encore atteint leur plein developpement, el 1'organisation en a ete differee en attendant la decision de PAssemblee. On espere que, au debut de l'annee prochaine, on renforcera ces sections et il est tout a fail possible que la creation d'une ou deux nouvelles sections soil necessaire. On calcule que, avec ces developpemenls, en considerant l'annee dans son ensemble, on peut regarder comme raisonnable une depense mensuelle moyenne d'environ 350,000 francs-or ou de 4,200,000 francs-or, par an.b) PERSONNEL, DIVERS200,000 francs-or.Cette estimation fut etablie par Pex-gerant de 1'lTdtel National, d'accord avec le chef du service inlerieur de la Societe. On compte que le personnel necessaire comprendra :f surveillant. 3 portiers. 1 mecanicien. 1 jardinier. 2 chauffeurs. 1 concierge. 1 veilleur de nuit. 3 garcons d'ascenseurs. 4 telephonistes. 19 plantons. '2. - FRAIS DE TRANSPORT ET DE DISPLACEMENT DES FONCTIONNAIRES DE LA SOCIETE 150,000: francs-or.Bien qu'il soil tout a fait probable que toutes les reunions de PAssemblee, du Gonseil et des differentes Commissions placees sous le contr6le de la Societe, aient lieu dorenavant a Geneve, on estime neanmoins que les membres du Secretariat devrout effecluer Ires frequemment des emplacements pour les besoins de leurs fonctions, Par exemple, les membres de la section de transit, devront necessairement assister aux reunions des differentes Commissions fluvialesdans diverses parties de PEurope : Petude. sur place des questions politiques courantes necessitera la presence des membres de a section politique dans les diverses capitales, et le controle de l'application des clauses relatives aux minorites pourra entrainer de longs voyages, dans des pays lointains.3, - SESSION DE L!ASSEMBLED A GENEVE 150,000 francs-or.La reunion de PAssemblee, nieme si elle se tient a Geneve, siege de la Societe, entrainera necessairement de grosses depenses extraordinaires.II esl indispensable d'engager a litre temporaire du personnel supplemental, pour renforcer les services qui sent le plus directement affectes par le surcroit de travail, tels que la section des interprets et des traducteurs, le Bureau central des dactylographes et le service de distribution. On a du prevoirquinze stenographes (temporaires) en supplc-ment. II taut egalement s'assurer le concours d'une imprimerie, louer une salle pour les seances'publiques, et retenir un certain nombre d'automobiles pour maintenir la liaison enlre la salle des seances de PAssemblee, le bureau central de la presse, les bureaux des delegations et le Palais des Nations. II."DIRECT expenditure ,-SALARIES, WAGES AND ALLOWANCES :(a) SECRETARIAT4,200,000 gold francs.It is estimated that by the first of January, 1921, the regular monthly pay roll of the Secretariat will be about 800,000 gold francs. A number of sections are as yet undeveloped, such as Transit, Mandates, etc., and their organisation has been delayed awaiting the decisions of the Assembly. It is anticipated that, early in (he new year, these sections will he brought up to strength, and it is quite possible that the creation of one or more additional sections may be required. In view of these developments it is calculated that, taking the year as a whole, and average monthly expenditure of approxi-mately 350,000 gold francs per month, or 4,200,000 gold francs per year may be regarded as reasonable.(b) HOUSEHOLD STAFF: 200,000 gold francs.This estimate was made by the former Manager of the Hotel National in conjunc-tion with the Establishment Officer of the League. It is expected that the following house staff will be required :1 Superintendent, 3 Porters, 1 Engineer, 1 Gardener, 2 Coal porters, 1 Janitor,1 Night Watchman, 3 Lift Boys,4 Telephone Operators and 19 Messengers.2. TRAVELLING EXPENSES OF OFFICIALS OF THE LEAGUE :150,000 gold francs.Whilst it is fully assumed that all meetings of the Assembly, the Council and the various Commissions under the control of the League will be hereafter held in Geneva, it is nevertheless to be expected that Members of the Secretariat will still have to do considerable travelling in connection with their work. For instance, Members of the Transit Section will neeessarily have to be present at meetings of various River Corn-missions in different parts of Europe ; the study of current political questions on the spot will require the presence of members of the Political Section at national capitals and the supervision of the minorities questions may entail long journeys to distant countries.3.-MEETING OF THE ASSEMBLY AT GENEVA 150,000 gold francs.A Session of the Assembly, even if held at Geneva, the Seat of the League, necessarily involves much extraordinary expenditure.A special temporary Staff has to be engaged to strengthen the departments most directly affected by the pressure of work, such as the Interpreters and Translators' Department, the Pool of Typists and Distribution Branch. Not less than fifteen Verbatim Reporters require to be appointed temporarily. Arrangements may also have to be made to take over at least one printing office, to rent a hall for the Public Sessions, and finally to secure the use of a number of motor-cars to maintain constant communication between the Assembly Hall, the headquarters of the Press, the Offices of the Delegations and the Offices of the Secretariat. h.......... Des dispositions seront prises pour reunir la correspondance a Paris et 1'envoyer dans certaines capitales par les valises des diverses Ambassades et Legations.7.- JOURNAL OFFIGI EL, PUBLICATION ET FRAIS D'ENVOI100,000 francs-or.Le Journal Officiel tie la Sociele des Nations contient les documents ofticiels communiques a la Societe des Nations ou enregistres par elle (traites, conventions, correspondance, etc.), et les comptes rendus de toutes les reunions publiques de la Societe.Tous les trailes enregistres an Secretariat seront inseres au journal, ainsi qirun compte rendu inexlenso des sessions de 1'Assembler.Naturellement, le prix varie selon ^importance du fascicule et du tirage.
